item.title: Sandy paths are unusable, 11th January
item.description:
The sandy pathways in Beckenham Place Park need to be finished off as they are unusable in this weather. The area around the new lake has been finished and is fine but this is a tiny area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Greenway, Southend, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continued build up of rubbish between 30-36 Camberwell Rd, 11th January
item.description:
Re ref 8564294 - see original report 18 Dec below. The new rubbish has now built up as predicted. There seem to be three distinct problems: (1) Packing materials and pallets apparently left out by Honey Bee Logistics (36 Camberwell Rd). (2) Two grey bins which must originally have belonged to the Dallas chicken shop (30 Camberwell Rd) which are full an never emptied. (3) Additional refuse left by others, possibly residents in the flats, because they see the bins. The new rubbish should be cleared and, most importantly, the bins removed to deter further dumping. FixMyStreet ref: 8564294. Photo of this reportzoom I reported this problem a month or so ago and it was cleared - thank you. But it is now recurring. Originally there was one bin. After it was cleared there are now two. But neither are emptied. Please establish who is responsible for the dumping and the bins. And arrange for the bins to be emptied regularly, or removed if they are not to be emptied. If this is not remedied the problem will simply recur, with resulting health and fire hazards. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grosvenor Terrace, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
